opendial.bn.distribs.other

Class EmpiricalDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.other.EmpiricalDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndependentProbDistribution, ProbDistribution

    public class EmpiricalDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndependentProbDistribution
    Distribution defined "empirically" in terms of a set of samples on the relevant variables. This distribution can then be explicitly converted into a table or a continuous distribution (depending on the variable type).
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 21:16:08 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • pruneValues

        public void pruneValues(double threshold)
        Prunes all samples that contain a value whose relative frequency is below the threshold specified as argument. DoubleVal and ArrayVal are ignored.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getPosterior

        public EmpiricalDistribution getPosterior(Assignment condition)
        Returns the posterior distribution associated with the empirical distribution given the conditional assignment provided as argument. This posterior distribution is either discrete or continuous (depending on the preferred format for the head variables).
        Specified by:
        getPosterior in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        condition - the assignment for the conditional variable
        Returns:
        the resulting probability table

      • getValues

        public java.util.Set<Assignment> getValues(ValueRange range)
        Returns the possible values for the head variables of the distribution. For efficiency reason, the input values are ignored, and the distribution simply outputs the head variable values present in the samples.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        range - the range of input values for the conditional variables (is ignored)
        Returns:
        the possible values for the head variables
